sen.j: 磯貝 宗和（いそがいそうわ、1854年 - 1940年）は、石州流宗猿系の家元。
sen.e: Sowa ISOGAI (1854 - 1940) was Iemoto (the head family) of Soen-kei group of Sekishu school.
Sowa ISOGAI (1854 - 1940) was Iemoto (the head family) of Soen-kei group of Sekishu school.
Sowa ISOGAI (1854 - 1940) was Iemoto (the head family) of Soen-kei group of Sekishu school.
His professional name was Tokaan (桃可菴).
His professional name was Tokaan (桃可菴).
His professional name was Tokaan (桃可菴).

sen.j: 都古流華道流祖の空瓢堂磯貝一阿彌の夫人。
sen.e: She was a wife of Kuhyodo Hitoami ISOGAI, the founder of flower arrangement of Miyako Koryu school.
She was a wife of Kuhyodo Hitoami ISOGAI, the founder of flower arrangement of Miyako Koryu school.
She was a wife of Kuhyodo Hitoami ISOGAI, the founder of flower arrangement of Miyako Koryu school.
Her real name was Waka (和歌).
Her real name was Waka (和歌).
Her real name was Waka (和歌).

sen.j: 片桐宗猿に伝わる片桐貞昌の茶の湯を梶宗龍より継承する。
sen.e: Sadamasa KATAGIRI's tea ceremony handed down to Soen KATAGIRI was passed on to Sowa from Soryu KAJI.
Sadamasa KATAGIRI's tea ceremony handed down to Soen KATAGIRI was passed on to Sowa from Soryu KAJI.
Sadamasa KATAGIRI's tea ceremony handed down to Soen KATAGIRI was passed on to Sowa from Soryu KAJI.

sen.j: 宗猿の茶系譜は宗和によって東京中心に広められた。
sen.e: Soen's pedigree record of the tea school was extended around Tokyo by Sowa.
Soen's pedigree record of the tea school prevailed centering around Tokyo by Sowa.
sen.cmt: was extended around ⇒ prevailed centering around に訂正しました。
sen.e: Soen's pedigree record of the tea school prevailed centering around Tokyo by Sowa.
